Package com.taco.suit_lady.view.ui

Class Displayer<T extends Displayable>

java.lang.Object
com.taco.suit_lady.view.ui.Displayer<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of Displayable displayed by this Displayer.
public class Displayer<T extends Displayable> extends Object

Contains logic for easily displaying Displayable objects.

See Also:
Displayable

  • Property Details

    • display

      public javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyObjectProperty<T extends Displayable> displayProperty

      Returns the Property containing the Displayable object managed by this Displayer instance.

      See Also:
      getDisplay(), setDisplay(T)

    • hidden

      public javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty hiddenProperty

      A BooleanProperty defining whether this Displayer should display its contents.

      1. Contrary to visibleBinding(), the hiddenProperty() only defines whether or not the Displayer should display its contents.
      2. In other words, if the Displayable is invalid or otherwise cannot be displayed for any reason, the value of hiddenProperty() is irrelevant.
      3. In other other words, hiddenProperty() defines the intention, whereas visibleBinding() defines the actual display state.
      See Also:
      isHidden(), setHidden(boolean)

  • Constructor Details

    • Displayer

      public Displayer()

      Constructs a new Displayer that contains the logic and details pertaining to a particular Displayable implementation.

      1. new Displayer() is identical to new Displayer(null, null).

      Refer to the fully parameterized constructor for details.

      See Also:
      Displayer(ReentrantLock, StackPane), Displayer(StackPane)

    • Displayer

      public Displayer​(javafx.scene.layout.StackPane displayContainer)

      Constructs a new Displayer that contains the logic and details pertaining to a particular Displayable implementation.

      1. new Displayer(displayContainer) is identical to new Displayer(null, displayContainer).

      Refer to the fully parameterized constructor for details.

      Parameters:
      displayContainer - A StackPane that the displayable content will be displayed on.
      See Also:
      Displayer(ReentrantLock, StackPane), Displayer()

    • Displayer

      public Displayer​(ReentrantLock lock, javafx.scene.layout.StackPane displayContainer)

      Constructs a new Displayer that contains the logic and details pertaining to a particular Displayable implementation.

      1. The Displayable is added to the specified StackPane.
      2. The Displayable's dimensions are automatically bound to the StackPane's dimensions.
      3. If the specified lock is null, a new ReentrantLock instance will be automatically constructed.
      4. If the specified display container is null, a new StackPane instance will be automatically constructed.
      Parameters:
      lock - The ReentrantLock object that will be used to synchronize this Displayer instance. Can be null.
      displayContainer - A StackPane that the displayable content will be displayed on. Can be null.
      See Also:
      Displayer(StackPane), Displayer()

  • Method Details

    • getDisplayContainer

      public javafx.scene.layout.StackPane getDisplayContainer()

      Returns the StackPane instance that this Displayer is displaying its contents on.

      Returns:
      The StackPane instance that this Displayer is displaying its contents on.

    • setDisplay

      public void setDisplay​(T displayable)

      Sets the Displayable object managed by this Displayer instance to the specified value.

      Parameters:
      displayable - The Displayable object to be managed by this Displayer instance.
      See Also:
      displayProperty(), getDisplay()

    • hiddenProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty hiddenProperty()

      A BooleanProperty defining whether this Displayer should display its contents.

      1. Contrary to visibleBinding(), the hiddenProperty() only defines whether or not the Displayer should display its contents.
      2. In other words, if the Displayable is invalid or otherwise cannot be displayed for any reason, the value of hiddenProperty() is irrelevant.
      3. In other other words, hiddenProperty() defines the intention, whereas visibleBinding() defines the actual display state.
      See Also:
      isHidden(), setHidden(boolean)

    • isHidden

      public boolean isHidden()

      Returns the value of hiddenProperty().

      1. isHidden() is identical to hiddenProperty().get().
      Returns:
      True if this Displayer instance is currently set to hide its contents, false if it is not.
      See Also:
      hiddenProperty(), setHidden(boolean), visibleBinding()

    • setHidden

      public void setHidden​(boolean hidden)

      Tells this Displayer instance whether it should attempt to display its contents or not.

      1. setHidden(hidden) is identical to hiddenProperty().set(hidden).
      Parameters:
      hidden - True if this Displayer instance should hide its contents, false if it should not.
      See Also:
      hiddenProperty(), isHidden(), visibleBinding()

    • visibleBinding

      public javafx.beans.binding.BooleanBinding visibleBinding()

      A BooleanBinding bound to the logic that determines if this Displayer instance is currently displaying its contents or not.

      1. Contrary to hiddenProperty(), the visibleBinding() is a calculated value that is bound to the actual display state of this Displayer's contents.
      Returns:
      The BooleanBinding bound to the logic that determines if this Displayer instance is currently displaying its contents or not.
      See Also:
      isVisible(), hiddenProperty()

    • isVisible

      public boolean isVisible()

      Checks if this Displayer instance is currently displaying its contents or not.

      1. isVisible() is identical to visibleBinding().get().
      Returns:
      True if this Displayer instance is currently displaying its contents, false if it is not.
      See Also:
      visibleBinding(), hiddenProperty()

    • bind

      public void bind​(javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<T> observable)

      Binds the Displayable instance managed by this Displayer to the specified ObservableValue.

      1. If the specified ObservableValue is a Binding, the Binding is invalidated immediately upon being bound.
      2. If the specified ObservableValue is null, a NullPointerException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      observable - The ObservableValue to define the Displayable object managed by this Displayer via a binding.
      See Also:
      isBound(), unbind(), ObjectPropertyBase.bind(ObservableValue)

    • isBound

      public boolean isBound()

      Checks if the contents of this Displayer object is currently bound or not.

      1. Internally, isBound() is identical to displayProperty.isBound().
      2. Note that the displayProperty field is a ReadOnlyObjectWrapper, whereas displayProperty() returns a ReadOnlyObjectProperty.
      Returns:
      True if the contents of this Displayer object are currently bound, false if they are not.
      See Also:
      bind(ObservableValue), unbind(), ObjectPropertyBase.isBound()

    • unbind

      public void unbind()

      Unbinds the contents of this Displayer.

      1. If the contents of this Displayer are not bound, this method does nothing.
      See Also:
      bind(ObservableValue), isBound(), ObjectPropertyBase.unbind()

    • onDisplaySwitch

      private void onDisplaySwitch​(T oldDisplayable, T newDisplayable)

      An internal method that is called whenever the contents of this Displayer are changed.

      Functionality Details

      1. If non-null, the new displayable parameter is automatically bound to the display container.
        1. The binding orientation is set to BOTH.
        2. The binding type is set to BOTH.
      2. If the oldDisplayable parameter is non-null but contains null contents, a NullPointerException is thrown.
      3. If the newDisplayable parameter is non-null but contains null contents, no special actions are taken and this method returns silently.

      Implementation and Usage Details

      1. This method is called internally via a ChangeListener.
      2. This method should never be called manually or otherwise outside of the ChangeListener.
      3. The ChangeListener is defined and added in the constructor.
      Parameters:
      oldDisplayable - The previous contents of this Displayer.
      Will be null if this Displayer had no previous contents.
      newDisplayable - The new contents of this Displayer.
      Will be null if the contents of this Displayer are being removed.
